litematica_printer.config.autoInventory: Remote Interaction - Auto Set Remote Interaction
Automatically enable remote container interaction if allowed by the server; otherwise, disable it automatically
litematica_printer.config.bedrock.commen: Calls the BedrockMiner mod to mine bedrock; this feature is unavailable if BedrockMiner is not installed.
litematica_printer.config.blocklist.comm:
You can enter item IDs or translated names in the current language, e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix to enable tag matching, and the list will match corresponding blocks by tag, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Enter text and filter conditions together (separated by English commas), e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
Where "c" means contains match, prioritizing pinyin or direct match (other matching methods are not yet implemented).
litematica_printer.config.breakBlocksPer:
Number of blocks that can be broken per game tick when §6§lPrinter Work Interval§r is set to §b0§r. Higher values mean faster breaking speed;
Setting to §b0§r removes the limit (may trigger anti-cheat mechanisms on servers). It is recommended to enable §6§lUse Packets for Breaking§r to optimize performance.
litematica_printer.config.breakCheckBloc:
Whether to filter out blocks with no hardness (unbreakable) during iterative break checks
Enabled by default in most cases (required by some users)
Cooldown duration (game ticks) after breaking a block at the same position; operation retries after cooldown ends.
§c§lDo NOT set to 0! This causes repeated breaking requests, leading to server lag or anti-cheat detection!§r
litematica_printer.config.breakPlaceUseP: Executes mining operations via packets, which reduces the occurrence of "ghost blocks".§r
litematica_printer.config.breakProgressT:
Progress threshold for mining blocks; mining is considered complete when this percentage is reached (range: 70-100%).
Higher values result in a more vanilla-like mining experience but slower speed; lower values speed up mining but may skip some block animations.
litematica_printer.config.breakSpeed.com:
Interval time (game ticks) for breaking blocks.
Set to 0 for no interval (may cause server lag); recommended to set to 1-5 to balance speed and performance.
When set to §b0§r, the §6§lBlocks Executed Per Tick§r option is activated (requires reopening the settings menu).
litematica_printer.config.category.all.c: Master category containing all configuration items; view/modify all printer-related settings
litematica_printer.config.checkPlayerInt: Core - Check Player Block Interaction Range

When enabled, the printer only processes blocks within the PlayerBlockInteractionRange.
Blocks outside this range will not be printed/mined/filled, avoiding detection by the server for cross-range operations.
litematica_printer.config.closeAllMode.c: Close all working modes; if in single-mode state, automatically revert to Print mode.
litematica_printer.config.cloudInventory:
Supports remote item interaction when the server allows remote container access or in single-player mode.
Interaction location is the preset container position of the schematic.
litematica_printer.config.debugOutput.co: When enabled, the console outputs debug information of the printer.
litematica_printer.config.easyPlaceProto: Use Litematica's Easy Place protocol for block placement.
litematica_printer.config.excavateBlackl:
Blocks in this list are prohibited from being mined in Excavation mode.
You can enter item IDs or translated names in the current language, e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Enter text and filter conditions together (separated by English commas), e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
Where "c" means contains match, prioritizing pinyin or direct match.
Block filtering rules for Excavation mode, including three types: Unlimited, Whitelist, Blacklist:
§dUnlimited§r: No restrictions on mined blocks
§dWhitelist§r: Only blocks in the whitelist can be mined
§dBlacklist§r: Blocks in the blacklist are prohibited from being mined
§lNote: This setting is ignored when using Tweakeroo's excavation limit presets.§r
litematica_printer.config.excavateLimite:
Source of excavation limit rules:
§dTweakeroo Preset§r: Use excavation limit rules from the Tweakeroo mod
§dCustom§r: Use custom excavation limit rules from this mod.
litematica_printer.config.excavateWhitel:
Only blocks in this list can be mined in Excavation mode.
You can enter item IDs or translated names in the current language, e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Enter text and filter conditions together (separated by English commas), e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
Where "c" means contains match, prioritizing pinyin or direct match.
litematica_printer.config.fill.comment: Place blocks configured in the §6Filling Block List§r within the selection range.
Block list used for Filling mode, following the same configuration rules as the "Base Block List".
Block selection mode for filling:
§dWhitelist Mode§r: Use blocks in the configured list
§dHandheld Mode§r: Use the block held in the main hand
litematica_printer.config.fillModeFacing: Facing setting for direction-sensitive blocks (e.g., slabs, stairs) during filling.
litematica_printer.config.fillSelectionT:
Working selection range rules for Filling mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area as the working range
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only execute filling within the current render layer of the schematic
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height in the selection
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height in the selection
litematica_printer.config.fluid.comment: By default, place blocks configured in the §6Fluid Draining Block List§r at lava source/water source locations.
litematica_printer.config.fluidBlockList:
Block list used to replace fluids. Enter item IDs or translated names, e.g.: §bminecraft:sand§r §bSand§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#sand§r.
litematica_printer.config.fluidList.comm: List of fluids to be replaced; only fluid IDs are accepted, e.g.: §bminecraft:water§r.
litematica_printer.config.fluidModeFillF: When enabled, flowing fluids are also treated as targets for filling/replacement.
litematica_printer.config.fluidSelection:
Working selection range rules for Fluid Draining mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area as the working range
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only execute fluid draining within the current render layer of the schematic
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height in the selection
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height in the selection
litematica_printer.config.forcedSneak.co: Automatically keep sneaking during printing to avoid accidental block interactions (e.g., opening chests, activating redstone components).
Whitelist of containers recognizable and usable by the printer; only containers in the whitelist are called by the printer.
litematica_printer.config.last.comment: Switch to the previously bound container
litematica_printer.config.mine.comment: Mine all non-fluid blocks within the selection range.
litematica_printer.config.mineSelectionT:
Working selection range rules for Excavation mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area as the working range
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only execute excavation within the current render layer of the schematic
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height in the selection
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height in the selection (default)
litematica_printer.config.modeSwitch.com:
§dSingle Mode§r: Only one working mode runs at a time
§dMulti Mode§r: Multiple working modes can run simultaneously
§lNote: You need to reopen the settings menu to see mode changes after switching.§r
litematica_printer.config.multiBreak.com: When enabled, operations are executed by mode priority; low-priority modes pause when high-priority modes are running.
litematica_printer.config.next.comment: Switch to the next bound container
litematica_printer.config.openScreen.com: Hotkey to open the printer settings menu (current interface).
litematica_printer.config.placeBlocksPer:
Number of blocks that can be placed per game tick when §6§lPrinter Work Interval§r is set to §b0§r. Higher values mean faster printing speed;
Setting to §b0§r removes the limit (may trigger anti-cheat mechanisms on servers). It is recommended to enable §6§lPlace Blocks via Packets§r to optimize performance.
Cooldown duration (game ticks) after placing a block at the same position; placement retries after cooldown ends.
§c§lDo NOT set to 0! This causes repeated placement requests, leading to server lag or anti-cheat detection!§r
litematica_printer.config.placeSpeed.com:
Interval time (game ticks) for the printer to place blocks.
Set to 0 for no interval (may cause server lag); recommended to set to 1-5 to balance speed and performance.
When set to §b0§r, the §6§lBlocks Executed Per Tick§r option is activated (requires reopening the settings menu).
litematica_printer.config.printBreakWron: When enabled, the printer automatically breaks blocks inconsistent with the schematic during printing.
litematica_printer.config.printHotkey.co: Hold the bound hotkey to make the printer place blocks continuously.
litematica_printer.config.printInAir.com: Place blocks directly in empty positions regardless of support requirements (suitable for unsupported decorative blocks).
litematica_printer.config.printMode.repl:
In Replacement mode, replace specified source blocks in the selection with target blocks.
Enter source block ID/translated name and target block ID/translated name (separated by English colon), e.g.: §bminecraft:stone:minecraft:oak_planks§r §bStone:Oak Planks§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs:minecraft:oak_planks§r (replace all logs with oak planks).
litematica_printer.config.printWater.com: Generate water source blocks by "placing ice → breaking ice" to print water sources.
litematica_printer.config.printerAutoDis: Automatically disable the printer when the player dies to avoid abnormal operations from the printer after death.
litematica_printer.config.printerAutoFil:
Automatically fill composters with compostable items to generate bone meal.
(§lWarning: This operation consumes compostable items in the inventory!§r)

Whitelist of compostable items used for automatic composter filling.
Enter item IDs or translated names in the current language, e.g.: §bminecraft:wheat§r §bWheat§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#compostable§r.
Add ",c" after text for contains match (prioritizing pinyin/direct match), e.g.: §lWheat,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.printerAutoStr: When enabled, if there are no stripped logs in the inventory, place regular logs first and then automatically strip them with an axe to save manual operation time.
litematica_printer.config.printerAutoTun: Automatically adjust note blocks to the pitch specified in the schematic during printing.
litematica_printer.config.printerBreakEx: When enabled, the printer automatically breaks extra blocks not present in the schematic during printing.
litematica_printer.config.printerBreakWr:
When enabled, the printer breaks blocks with "matching type but incorrect state" during printing (experimental feature).
Examples: stairs/slabs with wrong facing, vines with extra faces, etc.; blocks that can be corrected by clicking (e.g., trapdoors, campfires) will not be broken.
litematica_printer.config.printerFalling: When enabled, check if the block below falling blocks (sand, gravel, etc.) matches the schematic; do not place if mismatched.
litematica_printer.config.printerInvento:
If the remote item retrieval target is in an unloaded chunk, retrieval time increases; select a schematic selection and press the hotkey to bind printer inventory.
The printer prioritizes using items from this inventory when working; it is recommended to place a fake player entity in the inventory area to keep chunks loaded.
litematica_printer.config.printerIterato:
Order of block iteration during printing:
§dXYZ§r: X-axis first, then Y-axis, finally Z-axis
§dXZY§r: X-axis first, then Z-axis, finally Y-axis
§dYXZ§r: Y-axis first, then X-axis, finally Z-axis
§dYZX§r: Y-axis first, then Z-axis, finally X-axis
§dZXY§r: Z-axis first, then X-axis, finally Y-axis
§dZYX§r: Z-axis first, then Y-axis, finally X-axis

Shape of the block iteration area for the printer:
§dCube§r: Cube with side length equal to §6§lWorking Radius§r (recommended value: 3)
§dSphere§r: Sphere with radius equal to §6§lWorking Radius§r (recommended value: 6)
§dOctahedron§r: Octahedron with side length equal to §6§lWorking Radius§r (adapted for special building structures)
Maximum time (milliseconds) allocated to block iteration per game tick; set to 0 for no limit.
litematica_printer.config.printerLagChec:
The printer detects packet reception latency during operation; if no new packets are received for more than 20 game ticks,
it will automatically pause work until packet reception resumes.
litematica_printer.config.printerMode.co:
Core working modes of the printer:
§dPrint§r: Restore blocks in the schematic (including facing, state, and other attributes)
§dExcavate§r: Mine non-fluid blocks within the selection range
§dBedrock Mining§r: Break bedrock within the selection range using game mechanics (only effective in specific versions/conditions)
§dFluid Drain§r: Replace fluids within the selection range with blocks from the §6Fluid Draining Block List§r
§dFill§r: Fill the selection with blocks from the §6Filling Block List§r
§dReplace§r: Replace specified blocks in the selection with target blocks (requires replacement rule configuration)

§b§lTip:§r Except for §dPrint§r mode, the operation range of other modes is based on Litematica selection.
litematica_printer.config.printerQuickSh:
Extract items directly from shulker boxes in the inventory to the printer inventory.
Extraction location is the preset position of the schematic; if all preset positions have shulker boxes, extraction is unavailable.
Cooldown time (game ticks) for the Quick Shulker Box feature to prevent server lag from frequent shulker box opening; set to 0 to disable cooldown.

§dSimulate Click§r: Open by right-clicking the shulker box slot in the inventory (requires server plugin support)
§dCall Mod§r: Open directly by calling the QuickShulker mod (unavailable if not installed)
litematica_printer.config.printerRange.c:
Maximum working radius (in blocks) of the printer centered on the player; higher values mean wider coverage.
This parameter is associated with §6§lIteration Area Shape§r; when set to 0, delays are automatically added to avoid incorrect facing of pistons/observers, etc.
It is not recommended to set to 0 when printing redstone machinery.
litematica_printer.config.printerSafelyO: Before placing an observer, check if the block on its detection side matches the schematic; place only if matched to avoid observer failure.
litematica_printer.config.printerSelecti:
Working selection range rules for Printing mode:
§dSchematic Selection§r: Use the full selected schematic area as the working range
§dSchematic Render Layer§r: Only execute printing within the current render layer of the schematic
§dSchematic Selection (Below Player)§r: Only process areas below the player's height in the selection
§dSchematic Selection (Above Player)§r: Only process areas above the player's height in the selection
litematica_printer.config.printerSkipWat: When enabled, skip placement of waterlogged blocks (e.g., waterlogged slabs, waterlogged trapdoors) during printing.
litematica_printer.config.printerUsePack: Replace regular placement logic with packet sending to reduce "ghost blocks"; §6§lNot recommended for regular users§r as it may cause placement anomalies.
litematica_printer.config.printerWorking:
Number of block operations executed per game tick (only effective when print interval is set to 0).
Recommended to set to 2-8 to balance speed and performance; excessively high values may result in being kicked from the server.
litematica_printer.config.printerXAxisRe: When enabled, the iteration order of the X-axis is reversed (from high to low).
litematica_printer.config.printerYAxisRe: When enabled, the iteration order of the Y-axis is reversed (from high to low).
litematica_printer.config.printerZAxisRe: When enabled, the iteration order of the Z-axis is reversed (from high to low).
litematica_printer.config.putSkip.commen: When enabled, the printer §6§lskips blocks in the Skip Placement List§r during printing.
litematica_printer.config.putSkipList.co:
List of blocks to skip during printing. Enter item IDs or translated names in the current language, e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add ",c" after text for contains match, e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.removePrintInv: Clear the list of bound printer inventories.
litematica_printer.config.renderHud.comm:
When the printer is working, display the current mode and number of processed blocks on the HUD (excluding Fluid Draining/Filling modes);
When §6§lLag Detection§r is enabled, packet reception latency is also displayed.
litematica_printer.config.renderLayerLim: Limit the printer's working range to the currently rendered layer of Litematica.
litematica_printer.config.replace.commen: Directly overwrite blocks in the §6§lReplaceable Block List§r (e.g., grass blocks, snow layers) without breaking the original blocks first.
litematica_printer.config.replaceCoral.c: When enabled, during dead coral printing: if no dead coral is in the inventory, use live coral instead automatically; if both are available, prioritize dead coral.
litematica_printer.config.replaceableLis:
List of blocks that can be directly overwritten during printing (no need to break original blocks first).
Enter item IDs or translated names in the current language, e.g.: §bminecraft:stone§r §bSandstone§r.
Add §b#§r as a prefix for tag matching, e.g.: §l#logs§r.
Add ",c" after text for contains match, e.g.: §lGlazed Terracotta,c§r.
litematica_printer.config.storeOrderly.c:
When the inventory is full, attempt to return items extracted from remote containers/Quick Shulker Boxes to their original positions;
This feature has poor performance (may cause lag) in version 1.18.2, so it is recommended to disable it.
litematica_printer.config.switchPrinterM: Switch the current working mode of the printer (Print/Excavate/Bedrock Mining, etc.).
After pressing the hotkey, record the currently targeted container and sync items from containers of the same type within the schematic selection to this container.
litematica_printer.config.syncInventoryC: Remote Interaction - Sync Containers Toggle Hotkey
Hotkey to quickly enable/disable the container sync feature.
Highlight color for container sync and printer inventory blocks; set to §l#00000000§r to disable highlighting.
litematica_printer.config.updateCheck.co: Automatically check for mod updates when entering the world for the first time.
litematica_printer.config.useEasyplace.c: When enabled, call Litematica's Easy Place feature without needing to enable precise placement additionally.
litematica_printer.update.available: Litematica Printer update available! Current version: %s, Latest version: %s
litematica_printer.update.download: >> Click here to download the latest version <<
litematica_printer.update.failed: Failed to check for updates. Please try again later.
litematica_printer.update.recommendation: It is strongly recommended to upgrade to the latest version to fix potential critical issues.
